Class ServerInitializer.Server_ControlLogic

Enclosing class:
ServerInitializer
public static class ServerInitializer.Server_ControlLogic
extends IdolInitializer.Console_ControlLogic
implements Clock.AlarmHandler

Server_ControlLogic is an IdolInitializer.Console_ControlLogic with the ability to advertise the service and to periodically update the advertisement.

Field Detail

_advertiseSelfAlarm

private Clock.Alarm _advertiseSelfAlarm
A recurring alarm that initiates advertising with a directory service. It expires after _advertiseSelfInterval milliseconds.

_advertiseSelfInterval

private int _advertiseSelfInterval
Number of milliseconds between successive invocations of advertise on the directory server Receptor. It's probably good if _advertiseSelfInterval is less than _advertiseSelfTTL to maintain the continuity of the advertisement.

_advertiseSelfTTL

private Integer _advertiseSelfTTL
Number of milliseconds for the directory server to advertise this server

_advertiseSelfResult

private SelectableFutureResult _advertiseSelfResult
The value that the directory server's advertise method returned. It's obtained in receptorReadyIndication. handle(Selectable, SignalType) tells us when the real value is available.

See Also:
receptorReadyIndication(ClientSideFSM), handle(Selectable, SignalType)

_advertiseSelfFSM

private ClientSideFSM _advertiseSelfFSM
The ClientSideFSM of the directory server from whom we obtained _advertiseSelfResult. Its value is assigned in receptorReadyIndication. When handle(Selectable, SignalType) tells us that _advertiseSelfResult is readable, we deregister _advertiseSelfFSM and set it to null.

See Also:
receptorReadyIndication(ClientSideFSM), handle(Selectable, SignalType)

_directoryServer

private ServerContact _directoryServer
Concact info for the directory server. The QoS contains only Advertiser.class.

Constructor Detail

ServerInitializer.Server_ControlLogic

public ServerInitializer.Server_ControlLogic(Properties p)
                                      throws EntityInitializer.InitializationException
Class constructor that uses the value of the property idol.directory.advertiseSelf.interval to determine how often to advertise and the value of the property idol.directory.advertiseSelf.TTL to determine how long each advertisement will be valid.

If either property is present in p, its value must be an integer greater than zero.

idol.directory.advertiseSelf.interval should be less than idol.directory.advertiseSelf.TTL in order to be able to re-advertise before the current advertisement expires.

Parameters:
p - the Properties of this Server_ControlLogic
Throws:
EntityInitializer.InitializationException - if either of the two properties is in p but its value is not an integer greater than zero
Method Detail

receptorReadyIndication

public void receptorReadyIndication(ClientSideFSM fsm)
If fsm is for a connection to a Directory server, advertise in it. Otherwise, just do the base class's actions.

In order for advertisement to work, the Entity's State must include a String field whose name is defined by QueryFields.DESCRIPTION_FIELDNAME.

Overrides:
receptorReadyIndication in class ControlLogic
Parameters:
fsm - the new connection to a server

handle

public void handle(Selectable sel,
                   SignalType st)
Processes the result of RMI to the directory service. Delegates all other selectables to the base class.

If sel is the SelectableFutureResult for an attempt to advertise with a directory service, then handle disconnects from the server and schedules itself to advertise again after the interval given by the property idol.directory.advertiseSelf.interval.

Specified by:
handle in interface Selectable.Handler
Overrides:
handle in class ControlLogic
Parameters:
sel - the Selectable that is readable, writable, or in error
st - the operation that may be performed on sel

handle

public void handle(Clock.Alarm m)
Re-advertises the Entity with the directory service.

Specified by:
handle in interface Clock.AlarmHandler
Parameters:
m - the alarm that expired
